title: Authors and Citation
text: Stef van Buuren. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Team G (2022). gsedread: Tools reading GSED validation data. R package version 0.8.0, https://github.com/D-score/gsedread.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gsedread: Tools for reading the GSED validation data},   author = {GSED Team},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.8.0},   url = {https://github.com/D-score/gsedread}, }

what: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: goal gsedread read validation data project Global Scales Early Development (GSED).

title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: Install gsedread package GitHub follows: CRAN version.

title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: need access SharePoint site sync data local OneDrive. file .Renviron home directory add line specifying location synced OneDrive, e.g., setting environmental variable ONEDRIVE_GSED, restart R, manually check whether able read OneDrive directory. following commands reads SF data GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22 directory returns tibble one record per administration. Count number records per file: Process variable names user-friendly alternative:
code: ONEDRIVE_GSED='/Users/username/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-Sharedlibraries-WorldHealthOrganization/CAVALLERA, Vanessa - GSED Validation 2021_phase I' dir(Sys.getenv("ONEDRIVE_GSED")) #>  [1] "Bangladesh Validation"                              #>  [2] "Baseline Analysis - OLD - NOV 2021"                 #>  [3] "DIF_country.png"                                    #>  [4] "Final Phase 1 Data - May 10th 2022"                 #>  [5] "GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22"    #>  [6] "GSED PHASE 1 DATA COLLECTED LOG"                    #>  [7] "GSED_data_quality_1_output_LF_TEST.csv"             #>  [8] "GSED_data_quality_1_output.csv"                     #>  [9] "GSED_phase1_merged_11_11_21.csv"                    #> [10] "interim DAZ values combined.csv"                    #> [11] "Interim validation data_phase I_May2021"            #> [12] "Master_data_dictionary_MAIN_v0.9.1_2021.04.22.xlsx" #> [13] "Pakistan Validation"                                #> [14] "Pemba Validation"                                   #> [15] "QUALITATIVE DATA PHASE 1 MAY 2022"                  #> [16] "Rplot.pdf"                                          #> [17] "Stop rule change exploration"                       #> [18] "t1.Rds" library(gsedread) data <- read_sf() dim(data) #> [1] 6228  160 table(data$file) #>  #>                ban_sf_2021_11_03 ban_sf_new_enrollment_17_05_2022  #>                             1421                               72  #>     ban_sf_predictive_17_05_2022                pak_sf_2022_05_17  #>                              473                             1761  #> pak_sf_new_enrollment_2022_05_17     pak_sf_predictive_2022_05_17  #>                               72                              459  #>                tza_sf_2021_11_01 tza_sf_new_enrollment_10_05_2022  #>                             1427                               74  #>     tza_sf_predictive_10_05_2022  #>                              469 rename_vector(colnames(data)[c(1:3, 19, 21:25)], lexout = "gsed2", trim = "Ma_SF_") #> [1] "file"      "gsed_id"   "parent_id" "date"      "gpalac001" "gpacgc002" #> [7] "gpafmc003" "gpasec004" "gpamoc005"

title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: package reads processes GSED data. store data. read_sf() read_lf() functions takes following actions: Constructs paths files OneDrive sync file; Reads specified datasets list; Internally specifies desired format column; Specifies available date data-time formats per file; Recodes empty, NA, -8888, -8,888.00 -9999 values NA; Repairs problems mixed data-time formats adaptive Pakistan data; Stacks datasets one tibble adds columns file adm; Removes records without GSED_ID. Item renaming rename_variables() relies item translation table https://github.com/D-score/gsedread/blob/main/inst/extdata/itemnames_translate.tsv.

what: Define column types for data reading — define_col
title: Define column types for data reading — define_col
text: Define column types data reading

title: Define column types for data reading — define_col
code: define_col(   ins = c("sf", "lf", "bsid"),   adm = c("fixed", "adaptive", "tan", "pak", "ban"),   date_format = "",   datetime_format = "" )

title: Define column types for data reading — define_col
text: ins Character, instrument adm Character, fixed adaptive date_format Specification read date field datetime_format Specification read datetime field

what: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
title: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
text: Read data Bayley Scales Infant Development III

title: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
code: read_bsid(   onedrive = Sys.getenv("ONEDRIVE_GSED"),   path = "GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22",   verbose = FALSE,   progress = FALSE,   warnings = FALSE )

title: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
text: onedrive Character, location local OneDrive sync path Character, path name within OneDrive verbose Logical. Print diagnostic info? Defaults `FALSE`. progress Logical. Show progress interactive session. Default `FALSE`. warnings Logical. Show warnings generated `readr::read_csv()`. Defaults `FALSE`.

title: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
text: tibble original data two column names: `file` (containing original file name) `adm` (fixed adaptive).

title: Read lf data — read_lf
text: Read lf data

title: Read lf data — read_lf
code: read_lf(   adm = c("fixed", "adaptive"),   onedrive = Sys.getenv("ONEDRIVE_GSED"),   path = "GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22",   verbose = FALSE,   progress = FALSE,   warnings = FALSE )

title: Read lf data — read_lf
text: adm Character, either "fixed" "adaptive" administration type onedrive Character, location local OneDrive sync path Character, path name within OneDrive verbose Logical. Print diagnostic info? Defaults `FALSE`. progress Logical. Show progress interactive session. Default `FALSE`. warnings Logical. Show warnings generated `readr::read_csv()`. Defaults `FALSE`.

title: Read lf data — read_lf
text: tibble original data two column names: `file` (containing original file name) `adm` (fixed adaptive). `adm == "fixed"` tibble 159 columns, one test administration per row. `adm == "adaptive"`, tibble 14 columns, one item administration per row.

title: Read lf data — read_lf
code: if (FALSE) { # assuming environmental variable ONEDRIVE_GSED has been set d <- read_lf() dim(d) }

title: Read sf data — read_sf
text: Read sf data

title: Read sf data — read_sf
code: read_sf(   adm = c("fixed", "adaptive"),   onedrive = Sys.getenv("ONEDRIVE_GSED"),   path = "GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22",   verbose = FALSE,   progress = FALSE,   warnings = FALSE )

title: Read sf data — read_sf
text: adm Character, either "fixed" "adaptive" administration type onedrive Character, location local OneDrive sync path Character, path name within OneDrive verbose Logical. Print diagnostic info? Defaults `FALSE`. progress Logical. Show progress interactive session. Default `FALSE`. warnings Logical. Show warnings generated `readr::read_csv()`. Defaults `FALSE`.

title: Read sf data — read_sf
text: tibble original data two column names: `file` (containing original file name) `adm` (fixed adaptive). `adm == "fixed"` tibble 159 columns, one test administration per row. `adm == "adaptive"`, tibble 14 columns, one item administration per row.

title: Rename variables — rename_variables
text: Supports translation item names SF, LF BSID.

title: Rename variables — rename_variables
code: rename_variables(   from,   trans = c("extend", "original", "sequence", "connect"),   lowercase = TRUE,   underscore = TRUE,   trim = TRUE )

title: Rename variables — rename_variables
text: character vector column names trans One "original", "sequence", "connect" "extend". Desired transformation ``. "original" "sequence" preserve original item names sequence. "connect" "extend" translate items names 9-position GSED lexicon. "connect" uses existing item names (useful joint analysis existing data), whereas "extend" defines new 9-position names item names ``. lowercase Sets variables lower case. underscore Replaces space (" ") dash ("-") underscore ("_") trim Removes "Ma_" string

title: Rename variables — rename_variables
text: character vector length `` processed names.

title: Rename variables — rename_variables
code: if (FALSE) { from <- c("file", "GSED_ID", "Ma_SF_Parent ID", "Ma_SF_C01", "Ma_SF_C02") rename_variables(from) rename_variables(from, "sequence", lowercase = FALSE) }

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
text: Translates names different lexicons (naming schema).

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
code: rename_vector(   input,   lexin = c("original", "sequential", "gsed", "gsed2"),   lexout = c("gsed2", "original", "sequential", "gsed"),   notfound = "copy",   contains = c("", "Ma_SF_", "Ma_LF_", "bsid_"),   underscore = TRUE,   trim = "Ma_",   lowercase = TRUE )

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
text: input character vector names translated lexin string indicating input lexicon. One "original", "sequential", "gsed" "gsed2". Default "original". lexout string indicating output lexicon. One "original", "sequential", "gsed" "gsed2". Default "gsed2". notfound string indicating input value found contains string filter translation table prior matching. Needed prevent double matches. default ("") filter. underscore Replaces space (" ") dash ("-") underscore ("_") trim substring removed `input`. Defaults "Ma_". lowercase Sets variables lower case. `lexin`? default `notfound = "copy"` copies input values output value. cases (e.g. `""` `NA_character_`), function uses string specified `notfound` replacement value.

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
text: character vector length `input` processed names.

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
code: input <- c("file", "GSED_ID", "Ma_SF_Parent ID", "Ma_SF_C01", "Ma_SF_C02") rename_vector(input) #> [1] "file"         "gsed_id"      "sf_parent_id" "gpalac001"    "gpacgc002"    rename_vector(input, lexout = "sequential", lowercase = FALSE) #> [1] "file"         "GSED_ID"      "SF_Parent_ID" "C01"          "C02"          rename_vector(input, lexout = "gsed", trim = "Ma_SF_") #> [1] "file"      "gsed_id"   "parent_id" "gsdlac001" "gsdcgc002"
